title: Ticket #5601: Limiting proxies do not work with Bosco
description:
Bosco is unable to limit proxies due globus failing (likely because of missing CA Certs). The OSG solved this a year ago by introducing a new variable to stop all limiting of proxies by the blahp. Attached is a patch copied from OSG's repo that works on HTCondor's blahp.

The next question is whether we should patch the blahp configuration to turn off proxy limiting by default. I vote yes, since the vast majority of our use cases do no require proxy limiting.

After applying this fix, Bosco will need to be updated, therefore:

  1. /src/condor_contrib/bosco/bosco_findplatform will need to be updated with the new Bosco URL's
  2. The FTP server needs the new updated Bosco tar balls.
remarks:
2016-Apr-06 11:44:16 by tim:
Tentatively marking this for 8.5.4. I still have to check if OSG will accept a development version for BOSCO. However, we do not want to change the behavior of the BLAHP in the stable release.

2016-Apr-06 16:16:03 by jfrey:
We could leave bosco_findplatform alone if we're willing to make the new BOSCO release version 1.2.4. I don't believe anything else has changed in the blahp or file transfer gahp that would break older BOSCO installations.

2016-Apr-06 16:19:04 by dweitzel:
Incrementing the patch version sounds good to me.

2016-Apr-18 15:09:08 by dweitzel:
I've downloaded and tested this new build. It works great!

Testing instructions:

  1. Install Bosco per normal RPM or whatever.
  2. Modify bosco_cluster to cp the tar ball downloaded from the condor website into the temporary directory, rather than curl from the ftp site.
  3. Run bosco_cluster.

This now works successfully with a htcondor-ce installation.
